title: Client is up, but no TFT?
body: I don't see it, does it come later today or something? I was really looking forward to it

replies.body: Yeah I agree, it's a bit confusing. They first state the game will launch the 25th. Technically it did but only for OCE and Japan. Then they tell us it's going to come out for NA "AM" of 26th. The patch drops an hour ago with a stated down time of "estimated 3 hours". Is back up in less than an hour with no TFT. I am not gonna get angry or frustrated but man, stop toying with my emotions right now lol.
ye I have been waiting since 5am bcs here the 9.13 droped early but there is no TFT, I was like "well they probably need to finish something lets wait" its 3PM now and still no TFT, i cri :(
Same here, waited all day for TFT, hope Riot explain whats going on
Apparently MOST of the new stuff in the patch is coming Friday.

well her collection page is so shes like 1% released round it up and bam 100%
/s
Y'all just take a chill pill. It's coming today most likely.
Git gud

ive seen your other posts you are far from polite, and myself i cannot find where you found this info so

It's coming today.

Holy shit the impatience in this community.

Just because a patch is live doesn't mean all content is available the second it goes live.
I agree, but the patch was for tft and it is not even on the client that is weird to me. it could be on the client and not playable. that would make more sense than not being there at all.
Tft is on for me but Qiyana and the skins still arent. so are they coming later today or what?

Patch Notes clearly states  "Qiyana and the arcade content will be released on 28th June at 13:00 Pacific Time."

That is 20:00 for EU.
Jebaited

The longer riot waits to put up tft the more of the wait time will be for more people. this post has over 2k reviews that means  2,000 people are waiting to play it. so the number accumulates each hour passing and when everyone presses play on tft the more likely the server will crash.

> [{quoted}](name=Chrønø X,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=LOelMnsq,comment-id=0016,timestamp=2019-06-26T13:29:01.413+0000)

That's only in PBE, a regular server can hold way more people than PBE. {{item:3157}}

Not actaully, the reason why pbe can't hold is because there is only 1 server for it , which is in NA. So people all around the world stuck into 1 pbe server means a trouble. They had to make a queue time for it to overcome the heat.
You literally just reiterated exactly what you tried to rebut. Their live infrastructure currently handles nearly 100M active, unique players per month. PBE doesn't (and is not architected to).
Will most likely be up around 10-11am PST so you've got awhile
man i was so ready for it
ITS UP NOW IN NA

Take a chill pill dude its still Early in the day.  Jez the latest it is in NA right now is  Almost 8 am and that is in the ester timezone. Also  One Ivern game does not mean its a new bug..... wait till you see it i n more then one .

And its not like you are in EUW, where you have to wait another whole Day to play it cause Riot releases it so late that you can't really play if you have to work. Be Lucky that Riots shit plan has you first

Because the fact that EU is getting it in their PM has nothing to do with time differences and you know when they are actually going to be at work......  I mean you relies  where their offices are right? I mean you know the people that  work their are human and they need this thing called sleep right?

> [{quoted}](name=ChaosLordMadis,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=LOelMnsq,comment-id=000e000000000000,timestamp=2019-06-26T12:38:50.262+0000)

Its Pacific PM which will be Nighttime for us at best when its around 4 PM Pacific and there are more than enough Offices in EU to handle the Release for EUW

So you believe that something should be released in EUW prior to NA because of timezone differences? You expect multiple separate deadlines to be made for the release of a feature? You believe that somehow, releasing the exact same thing several times (thus breaking out their codebase into several different branches and requiring patches/hotfixes to be applied to each individual branch) would be a GOOD idea? You believe that having several satellite teams working independently to release one feature wouldn't in fact push the deadline back even further? Have you had any interactions in the real world?

At this point, it's very likely already deployed. If we're still waiting, it means the patch was a dark launch and the feature needs to be activated. If we're waiting for activation, we're very likely waiting for infrastructure. If we're waiting for infrastructure, you can most certainly bet that it's virtually impossible for them to have released it earlier for EUW. That'd mean, to have staggered the activation, you'd have seen it in EUW tomorrow at the earliest. I mean, sure, to appease those who have no clue how things work, they could've postponed it and activated it tomorrow during your daytime hours instead of activating it immediately when infrastructure was ready. I don't see how that benefits you in any way, however.

> [{quoted}](name=Phreaktastic,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=LOelMnsq,comment-id=000e00000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-06-26T16:04:27.018+0000)
>
> So you believe that something should be released in EUW prior to NA because of timezone differences? You expect multiple separate deadlines to be made for the release of a feature? You believe that somehow, releasing the exact same thing several times (thus breaking out their codebase into several different branches and requiring patches/hotfixes to be applied to each individual branch) would be a GOOD idea? You believe that having several satellite teams working independently to release one feature wouldn't in fact push the deadline back even further? Have you had any interactions in the real world?
> 
> At this point, it's very likely already deployed. If we're still waiting, it means the patch was a dark launch and the feature needs to be activated. If we're waiting for activation, we're very likely waiting for infrastructure. If we're waiting for infrastructure, you can most certainly bet that it's virtually impossible for them to have released it earlier for EUW. That'd mean, to have staggered the activation, you'd have seen it in EUW tomorrow at the earliest. I mean, sure, to appease those who have no clue how things work, they could've postponed it and activated it tomorrow during your daytime hours instead of activating it immediately when infrastructure was ready. I don't see how that benefits you in any way, however.

It is deployed for sure at the Moment and just needs to be switched on and the Infrastructure is already there 100%. This Delay is completely Unnecessary and a Simultaneous Release would be no Problem since it's 2 completely separated Systems as far as we know from the Past.
They could have Released EUW the same time as NA without a doubt

You do know that even ignoring timezones, they are being released at different times, the issue is that they aren't. It is meant to be released in NA during the morning (PST), and in the evening for EU, which makes it early in the morning the next day for everyone who lives in europe. The argument you are using is literally exactly what riot is doing

It isn't. It's deploying at the same time, and happens to be a different number on a clock for those who see the sun at different times. There's a MASSIVE difference in doing something once, and doing something multiple times. Just because your clock reads differently due to being in a different position geographically, does not mean it was done at two separate times. If you don't know the basics of timezones, you probably shouldn't post.

Like mentioned above, it was likely a dark deploy. Meaning, we're waiting on infrastructure (NOT for a code deployment). The order the infrastructure is ready in has absolutely no bearing on virtually anything. That simply means that as infrastructure is made available and tested, it is given the green light. If they didn't have teams working on EU infrastructure in parallel to NA, you wouldn't see TFT for a week or more.

P.S. There being no further patches despite NA having TFT now confirms my above post. The deployment was made, dark launch was in the deployment, and we were waiting on infrastructure (and an activation of the feature). There's nothing else to be said here. There weren't multiple separate deployments, and EUW is not waiting for anything outside of infrastructure. Meaning, you're not picked on, Riot doesn't hate you, and you're not a victim. NA waited after infrastructure was up and running elsewhere as well. This is how things go for most every company that deploys features in software globally. It's life. No sense in whining about your position in the queue.

Are you for real ?
Timezone are not time traveling machine. Now is now for every person on Earth even if their clock read 7AM or 9PM. 
If it is deployed NOW in NA, it has to be deployed AT THE SAME TIME in EUW with your logic.

So why is it on in NA and not in EUW then ?
Your logic is flawed.

Since you don't understand what I posted, which is totally understandable (posting with opinionated rants/jabs from a position of pure ignorance, however, is not), I will break it down for you.

Being ready on NA and not on EUW confirms my post. There was no second patch for NA, meaning it was a dark deploy and we were all just waiting on infrastructure. One deployment pushed the code to clients. From there, clients were waiting for infrastructure.

If infrastructure was not being prepared in parallel to OCE/Japan/NA infrastructure, each region would've had TFT weeks apart, not hours. Read up on extremely basic infrastructure -- to support millions of simultaneous players takes incredible amounts of hours of planning, architecting, and setup. 

All EUW is waiting for at this point is for the infrastructure to be ready, which was likely already prepared/setup quite some time ago. The hours of waiting is likely due to testing and final approvals.

this is just stupid.
TFT is up for NA, which means, ppl who cant wait for this new game mode, simply log on NA, and play there.
What actualy made NA servers overheated.
I dont understand logic behind RIOT.
